items.title: Classic Cultural
items.summary: Overview The classic tour of Myanmar taking in the unmissable highlights of…
items.content_html:
Overview

The classic tour of Myanmar taking in the unmissable highlights of the country, including the ancient temples of Bagan, the serenity of Inle Lake and Mandalay, the last kingdom of Myanmar. 

Day 1

Exploring the surroundings of Mandalay, exploring its history, visiting the Three Ancient Cities of Sagaing, Amarapura and Ava (Innwa), ending the day with sunset at the famous U Bein bridge (the oldest teak bridge in the world).

Day 2

Take the boat along the Irrawaddy river to the magnificent ruin of Mingun, the towering 18th century temple overlooking the river, the nearby 90-ton bell from that era and the stunning and brilliantly white Myatheindan Pagoda.  

Back tom Mandalay, the tour will take you to the “Kuthodaw Pagoda”, fondly known as the world’s largest book, as well as the Golden Palace Monastery. The day will end at Mandalay Hill for sunset and the stunning view over the city.

Day 3

Drive to Bagan talking in the rainy season greenery of the Myanmar dry zone, arriving in time for a late lunch. Exploring the surroundings of Bagan by car.

Option (Boat – from Mandalay to Bagan) leave from the jetty at 7 am and will arrive Bagan before sunset.

Day 4

Visit Bagan ancient pagodas the whole morning time and in the evening around 4 pm, you will visit to Peter’s garden and you will visit the sunset boat tour on the Irrawaddy river. Enjoy the sunset at the boat and transfer back to the hotel.

Day 5

Start the day with Inle boat trip and head across the lake to the market village and we’ll take you by boat to Indein Village. Walking around the village passing the paddy fields where the farmers are doing plantations and visit the ancient buddha images on the hilltop pagoda and manufacturing workshops in the lake and see the amazing Inle one legged fishing style. Visit to the long neck tribal women of their waving style in the village and back to hotel. 

Day 6

Visit to Pintaya Pagoda which is 2 hour drive from Inle – Nyaung Shwe and driven back to the Red Mountain Vineyard to enjoy the sunset. Then come back to hotel and enjoy your own relaxing evening. 

Day 7

Enjoy your own activities in the morning and travel back to Yangon by flight (Transport option: by bus, flight, private car) 

End of a Memorable trip!




Trip Includes

All transfers, Visa fee, transportation, accommodation, entrance fees and guide fees, breakfast

Trip Excludes

Meals

Trip Outline

The exact trip will be tailored to your wishes, dependent upon your time available and desired budget.

items.title: Myitkyina - Indawgyi Lake
items.summary: Overview The guests will experience the uniqueness of Kachin starting the capital…
items.content_html:
Overview

The guests will experience the uniqueness of Kachin starting the capital of Myitkyina and then moving down to Indawgyi, one of the most beautiful natural lakes in Southeast Asia.

Day 1: (Myitkyina Airport Arrival - Kachin Museum- Manaw Park)

Guests will be greeted at the Myitkyina airport by our guide. Transfer to your hotel and check into your rooms.

After a short orientation for shops around their hotels, guests will visit sightseeing the Kachin Museum, and Manaw Park where you learn the Kachin people’s traditions, beliefs and their living style.  Guests will also be able to visit souvenir shops or other points of interest depending upon request. 

Evening be spent at a restaurant of the guests choosing. Recommended restaurants include several on the river with traditional Kachin food and drinks. Overnight at your hotel in Myitkyina. 

 Day 2:(Myitkyina-Hopin-Indawgyi Lake)

 Breakfast at hotel, afterwards guests will begin the journey to Indawgyi Lake, which is one of the largest inland lakes in Southeast Asia via.  Lunch will be served at local restaurant in Hopin on the way to Indawgyi lake. 

Guests will arrive at Indawgyi around 3 PM.  Evening sightseeing will start from Namde village (Elephant’s house) and will also include the famous Shwe Myitzu Pagoda, which sites on an island in Indawgyi lake. 


Dinner will be in a local restaurant. Guests will stay overnight at your guesthouse in Indawgyi.

Day 3: (Full day bird-watching around the Lake) 

After waking up, guests will have breakfast at the local teashop at 9am. 

After breakfast, we will travel around Indawgyi Lake is to visit around the beautiful lake by motor canoe. Guests can see wildlife including birds such as birds, Graylag Geese, Oriental Darters and Purple Swamp Hens and many others. 


We have lunch at the Lwemun village with relaxing views and tasty local foods.  

After lunch, we will explore old teak monastery and other points of interest around Indawgyi.  Guests may request additional activities such as kayaking, short hiking, or more sightseeing depending on their interest. 

On returning from exploring the lake, you relax in your hotel and have dinner nearby. 

 Day 4 Indawgyi Lake- MoeKaung- Return to Myitkyina

After Breakfast, heading back to Myitkyina arrived by noon. Lunch at the Kachin Traditional Restaurant.

The trip will conclude with a transfer to the airport for the evening flight to Yangon.

Trip Includes

All transfers, Visa fee, transportation, accommodation, entrance fees, insurance, and guide fees, breakfast, Lunch, Dinner air ticket fee

Trip Outline

The exact trip will be tailored to your wishes, dependent upon your time available and desired budget.

items.title: Yangon city life
items.summary: Overview Exploring Yangon is taking you to the sights of former British…
items.content_html:
Overview

Exploring Yangon is taking you to the sights of former British colonial city known as Rangoon. On the trip we are taking a walk to visit to see people living on and around of Yangon and learning about the history of colonial architecture and buildings, hidden down side streets, biggest concentration is on the river front Strand road, around the bottom of Pandsodan street, where you will see the local Myanmar people lifestyle. 


Are you ready to start your day? Let’s Unlock Yangon together – let’s go!


We will start sightseeing, we will start walking from Sule Pagoda, City Hall, Independent Monument and continue to see Colonial buildings, hidden down side streets, biggest concentration is on the riverfront Strand road, around the bottom of Pansodan street, You will see the local Myanmar people lifestyle in just one day!


Now of course, it is turn to learn about Tea! Tea is a part of Myanmar culture and important in daily life of Myanmar.We have tea for breakfast, lunch and dinner and tea shops are in the version of western bars in local people life.


Lunch time!! Let’s try some tasty and delicious traditional Burmese food an after that we visit to 

 Shwedagon Pagoda which is one of the must go when you are in Myanmar. Your mind will be peaceful with fresh air and cool breeze. What a beautiful end to a full day! 

 

Trip Includes

 Transportation, entrance fees and guide fees


Trip Excludes

Meals


Trip Outline

The exact trip will be tailored to your wishes, dependent upon your time available and desired budget.

items.title: Trekking in Chin
items.summary: Overview Trekking in Chin State will take you the discovery of the…
items.content_html:
Overview

Trekking in Chin State will take you the discovery of the lost tribe and the story of “

The Face- Tattooed Women in Chin State “ - their living culture, way of living and way of thinking. This trip is perfect for trek lover who love the challenging trek. This trekking tour is leading you to an adventurous trip finding out the fascinating mountain views, enjoyable scenery crossing the Chin mountains and learning about the local ethnic.


Day 1

Travel from Bagan and arrive at Kampetlet in the afternoon. Meet with your guide to explain you an overview of the trip plan. 

Day 2

Start your trekking to Htar Shwe village and you will learn the way of life of local people and you can learn more when you are doing home stay. Overnight in Htar Shwe 

Average walking hours is 6 to 7 hours but we have motorbike stand by.


Day 3

Trekking for the short walk to Kyar Bo village where you can see the different traditional arts including facial tatoos. Then you continue trekking before lunch break. From Kyar Bo you’ll continue on to Aye camp for a quick lunch break. After lunch you’ll cross the Chi River on your way to Luke Dee village. Spend your night in Luke Dee with a local Chin family. 


Day 4

The next morning, it’s time to hike out and you’ll leave Luke Dee village and walk down to Mindat. Enjoy your great meal in Mindat. After lunch, explore around Mindat. Overnight in Mindat


Day 5

Breakfast at the hotel and you can begin your journey back to Bagan.

End of memorable trip!


Trip Includes

All transfers, transportation, accommodation, entrance and guide fees, homestay fee, lunch, dinner, motorbike, breakfast

 

Trip Outline

The exact trip will be tailored to your wishes, dependent upon your time available and desired budget.

items.title: Waterfalls
items.summary: In Myanmar we have plenty of secret waterfalls! We are organizing daily waterfall…
items.content_html:
In Myanmar we have plenty of secret waterfalls! We are organizing daily waterfall tours in Mandalay and Pyin Oo Lwin.

It is time to get out and hit the countryside 😊 

 Just outside of Mandalay are limestone hills, tree-covered pagodas. 

Work up a sweat and get wet this tour is all about getting out and getting (a little) dirty and having fun. 

Daily Waterfall Tour (Mandalay)

  • Three Tiers Waterfall Daily tour 
  • Dee Dote Waterfall Daily Tour 

Daily Waterfall Tour (Pyin Oo Lwin) 

  • Anisakan falls or Dattawgyaik Waterfall 
  • Hampshire falls and caves (pwe kauk)

items.title: Kawtaung - Mergui Islands by Boat
items.summary: If you are wondering where is the best untouched beaches and Islands…
items.content_html:
If you are wondering where is the best untouched beaches and Islands to relax before your end of the trip in Myanmar? 

Here we go!!!  We recommended Kawthaung - which is the most southern part of town in Myanmar and from there you can access to a lot of fabulous islands by boat. It is part of Myeik Archipelago which has 

These islands are recently developed a few years ago and people visit here to do diving & snorkeling & chills at the beach.

Kawthaung is our first trip ever arranged by Unlock Myanmar “Snorkeling Tour “for our guests and THEY LOVE IT.

We can offer you: 

  • 3 Nights 4 Days Tour
  • 4 Nights 5 Days Tour
  • 5 Nights 6 Days Tour depend on your request

Flight schedule to Kawthaung is very limited and sometimes only one flight in a day.The boat trip starts 8:30 am in the morning and if your flight schedule in the afternoon , we arrange boat trip in next day. 

Standard 3 Nights 4 Days Tour

Day 1 – City Tour or Chill at the Hotel 

 When you arrive in Kawthaung you have option like you can visit city tour or you can relax at your hotel doing nothing the whole day. During the city tour, you are visiting to the attraction of the town places like - 

  • Bayint Naung Point (Victoria Point)
  • Bayint Naung Monument Square
  • Pyi Daw Aye Pagoda
  • Ngar Thone Lone Hill (555 Hill)
  • Pulon Tontone Beach and Bridge
  • Maliwon Waterfall and Hot Spring
  • City Market

Day 2 – Boat Trip

  • Depart at 08: 30 at the jetty
  • Visit beautiful islands by speedboat
  • Snorkeling, swimming around different islands, chilling out and taking photos
  • Lunch at island on the beach food, fruit and soft drinks served
  • Afternoon snorkeling around the islands
  • Overnight in tents with sweet dreams at Satan Island
  • Dinner served on Satin Island


Day 3 – Boat Trip

  • Breakfast at the tent on the beach
  • Snorkeling, swimming, visiting islands around the sea in a small boat
  • Lunch on the island 
  • Leave from the island at 1 pm after lunch 
  • Back to Kawthaung in the evening around 3:30 pm
  • Then we transfer to hotel 
  • Relax at the hotel in the evening time

Day 4 – End of the trip

  • Relax and swim at the hotel in the morning
  • Depart to the airport in the afternoon
  • The end of an amazing, memorable experience

You have many options to choose which island you would like to visit and how long because they are over 800 islands. And we can advise you for that. 

We are offering day return boat trip and overnight boat trip tours. You can do island hopping in one day or stay a few days more to chill at the beach.


Other Popular Island Tours

  • Naung Oo Phee Island
  • Zadetkyi island
  • Horse Shoe island
  • Dunkin island
  • 115 island
  • Cocks comb island (Heart Shape Island)

Lampi Island Tour (Marine National Park) – Day Trip 


Lampi Island, the only one of the marine National Park in Myanmar which is the most famous island in Mergui Archipelago. Many kinds of wildlife can see on this island. Moreover, there were various kinds of plants also growth on this island. There are more than three Mangrove rivers are situated on this island. 


  • Leave at 6 am in the morning to the village by car (approx. 1 & half hour) 
  • Boat trip around 2 and half hour to reach Lampi Island 
  • Visit around Lampi Island (swim, snorkeling & Chill)
  • Visit some villages near Lampi island 
  • Back to the village by boat at 3 pm in the afternoon 
  • Dinner on the way to town and back to hotel

The exact trip will be tailored to your wishes and interest, dependent on your time available and budget.

Includes all transfers, transportation, accommodation, entrance and guide fees, snorkeling equipment, buffet lunch, snack and life jacket.

items.title: Indawgyi Lake
items.summary: History Indawgyi Lake Wildlife Sanctuary, Myanmar’s largest natural lake, has long been…
items.content_html:
History

Indawgyi Lake Wildlife Sanctuary, Myanmar’s largest natural lake, has long been an isolated destination and remains largely unexplored. It was established as a green zone in 1999 and, until recently, was accessible only by unpaved mountain roads. The region is home to a large variety of wildlife including elephant, gaur, sun bear, gibbon, rare birds, and endemic fish and turtle species.

Geography

The lake sits peacefully among the Mangin Mountain Range in Kachin State, the northernmost province of Myanmar. The forests blanketing nearby mountains are untouched primary growth forest while the watershed surrounding the lake is a mix of scenic woodlands and rice paddy fields. The sanctuary is also considered the country’s most important wetland site as it is critical for the conservation of migrating water birds that flock in thousands from all over Central Asia and Siberia.


Climate

The best and easiest time to visit is during dry season from October to May. The first two months provide the best visibility since they directly follow rainy season, and during this time it is possible to view the entire lake. The coolest months are November through March when average temperatures stay a lovely 25ºC and below, but even during the summer months it rarely goes above 30 degrees. The rainy season is not a popular time to visit, but new road construction through the mountains will make access during this time much easier. And if you’re looking for a quiet and peaceful getaway, this is the ideal time to go.


Language

Basic English and Burmese can be used around Lone Ton and other tourist destinations at the lake but are not native to the region.

Three languages – Shan, Kachin, and more recently Burmese – are spoken around Indawgyi. Most villages surrounding the lake are Shan and are remnants of the Shan States which once extended all the way to India and south China. In the 1990s, Burmese migrants came to the lake seeking economic opportunities and, as a result, the Burmese language has become more prominent in recent years. 


Lone Ton Village

Lone Ton is located at the southwest end of the lake and is currently the only village that foreigners can stay. Like most villages on the western shore, only one paved road passes through the center of town and here you can find everything you need. The morning market (6-8am), small restaurants and tea shops, accommodation, electronics store, and activities can all be found on either side of the road. 


Around Lone Ton

Twelve other villages hug the lake in addition to Lone Ton and life there moves leisurely. The most famous site at the lake is Shwe Myitzu Pagoda, a gold-encrusted shrine that crowns the lake’s only island and looks as if it is floating on the water’s surface. An exciting time to go is in March when over 100,000 pilgrims visit for the annual pagoda festival the week before the full moon of Tabaung. At the end of dry season in March and April, the water level is low enough that you can walk out to the pagoda on a natural land bridge that was recently reinforced with a concrete walkway. Otherwise, you can hire a boatman for 2,000 kyat roundtrip.


Two other famous Buddhist sites are the Bamboo Buddha, sitting at 6 meters and made entirely of woven bamboo strands, in Nammilaung village and Shwe Taung Pagoda at the northernmost tip of the lake. Shwe Taung, meaning “Gold Mountain,” offer an incredible hilltop view of the entire lake but can only be reached by hired motorbike or motorboat due to its distance from Lone Ton. And if you’re lucky, you might catch a glimpse of a rare Gibbon species in the forests surrounding Shwe Taung.


Closer villages that can be reached by bicycle or kayak are worth a visit as many travelers say that interacting with the local communities is a highlight of their trip. Lwemun is perched on a hilltop north of Lone Ton and is a great place to stop for a break and drink a fresh coconut from one of the many roadside stands. Elephants can be seen in Namde and Nammilaung when on break from logging in the nearby forests. South of Lone Ton, you can buy textiles directly from the weavers in Maing Naung village. Across the lake and a day’s journey by kayak, Hepa village sits on the shore and is a scenic stop for both the mountains and the lake. If you walk a mile further to Intha village you can find locally-made baskets.


Eating

While more options are starting to pop up, the two main restaurants sit next to each other near the army check point. You can grab any meal here, but if you want to diversify your palette the house directly next to Indaw Mahar serves savory Burmese breakfast foods like Shan noodles and Mohinga, a spicy fish-based soup. Another great food option is across from the immigration office on the main road and serves delicious curries along with noodle dishes. A favorite in this area is the fish curry, or “nga-hin” in Burmese.

items.title: 3 Ancient Cities
items.summary: Three Ancient Cities Tour We are organizing daily tours and One of…
items.content_html:
Three Ancient Cities Tour 

We are organizing daily tours and One of them is popular Three Ancient Cities in One Day Culture Tour in Mandalay.

On this trip we’re going to ancient, Super ancient - Amarapura, Sagaing, and Inwa—three former capitals that you’ll get to see in one jam-packed day of pagodas, ruins and markets. Think of it as a crash course in Myanmar history and culture! 


  • Amarapura: The interesting place which become the center of Buddhism reforms and learning. You will see a lot of famous sacred shrines, pagoda, monasteries, traditional workshops there.
  • Mahar Myat Muni Pagoda
  • Mahar Gandar Yone Monastery
  • Silk Waving
  • Sagaing: One of the Myanmar’s ancient capitals, famous for its many hundreds of white, silver and gold pagodas and monasteries and its hilly landscape. 
  • Sagaing Hill
  • Sone Oo Pone Nya Shin Pagoda
  • 30 Cave Pagoda
  • Lunch break in Sagaing
  • Inwa (Ava): The capital of Myanmar kingdom for more than six hundred years. You will see the pagodas which are similar with Bagan and one of the pagoda “Yandanar Simi Pagoda is famous for “Pagoda Lost in the Garden”. Inwa is named after like” Mini-Bagan or Little Bagan”
  • Maha Aungmye Bonzan Monastery (Mal Nu  Monastery) 
  • Bargayar Monastery (Teak-constructed Monastery)
  • Yadanar Semi Pagoda
  • U Being Bridge: The best place to enjoy the sunset in Mandalay! 

The exact trip will be tailored to your wishes, dependent on on your time available and budget.

Includes all transfers, transportation, accommodation, entrance and guide fees.

items.title: Treking in Hsipaw
items.summary: Tour – Hsipaw Hsipaw is a loving town which is in the…
items.content_html:
Tour – Hsipaw

Hsipaw is a loving town which is in the northern part of Shan state.

 If you are looking for trekking experience in Myanmar – Hispaw is one of the best treks recommend to do!

Our experienced local English guide is ready to accompany with you in your adventure. 

During the trek, you will walk through the farmland, hills and jungle passing through bamboo forests and will get a great experience staying with the local family in the rural village like a local person. Food and accommodation are organized in villagers' houses. 

 A good chance to learn about the simple lifestyle of local people, clean air and fresh organic food from the farm and trees- Shan food is so good & delicious.

We can offer you:

Half Day Tour/ Full Day Tour 

  • Nam Tuk Gyi waterfall, Shan Villages & Par Pheik Hot Springs
  •  Little Bagan, Shan Village along the river (Boat Tour) 

You can go for a few hours hike or combine hiking with a boat on the river


Overnigh Treks

  • 1 Night 2 Days Trek
  • 2 Nights 3 Days Trek
  • 3 Nights 4 Days Trek

The mountains surrounding Hsipaw are home to the Palaung people, whom the legend says descend from dragons. During the overnight treks in Hsipaw you can observe the tea cultivation and their traditional way of life.

The exact trip will be tailored to your wishes and interest, dependent on your time available and budget.

Includes all transfers, transportation, accommodation, entrance and guide fees.

items.title: Ngapali Beach
items.summary: The best white sand beach in Myanmar, Ngapali Beach is situated in…
items.content_html:
The best white sand beach in Myanmar, Ngapali Beach is situated in Rakhine state and famous
for its palm trees and clear waters of the Bay of Bengal. Ngapali Beach is one of the loveliest places in Myanmar; it is also one of the most un-spoilt beaches in the world. Not so far from the hotels, there are the fisherman villages. Seeing them fishing is just authentic. As many of us now live in crowded cities with the stress and strain of over-population, we need periods of relaxation away from urban areas, and go back closer to nature. Ngapali is accessible by flight which takes about 1 hour from Yangon, by car about 14 hours drive along the Rakhine Yoma mountain range.
